Let me solve this carefully and methodically:

1) First, I'll recall standard order of operations (PEMDAS):
   • Parentheses first
   • Exponents
   • Multiplication/Division (left to right)
   • Addition/Subtraction (left to right)

2) In this problem: \( 1+2 \times(3-4) \)

3) I'll start INSIDE the parentheses: \( 3-4 = -1 \)
   So now the problem looks like: \( 1+2 \times(-1) \)

4) Next multiplication: \( 2 \times(-1) = -2 \)
   Now the problem is: \( 1+(-2) \)

5) Finally, addition: \( 1+(-2) = -1 \)

The key was doing the PARENTHESES first, then multiplication, then addition.

The answer cannot be "It doesn't matter" because order determines the result.

My confident answer is: C) \( 3-4 \)

Answer: C
